title: BRAVE Day for Sophomores - November 14th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
BRAVE 

DAY

BRAVE DAY

BRAVE Day at Talawanda High School is our annual family building and diversity event for our Sophomore class. The focus of the day is on making students realize that they are not alone at Talawanda, and they have many other peers and adults that care about and support them. Our students are a large part of our community, and by sharing stories, participating in activities, and most importantly - listening - they realize the important role they play with their classmates. Since 2009, BRAVE Day has been an influential part of our Anti-bullying, personal empowerment program at THS and our students come out of this experience better people for it.The event will take place…FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 14TH The effort that our students put into the day is an amazing thing to witness. Not only do students participate, they also encourage each other throughout the day on a level that is not normally seen in a typical High School. As a School District we appreciate their willingness to let go of their normal day and try to become a better person. Talawanda is thankful for them, and realizes that we have some of the most caring students around.If you feel your student would not benefit from the day, or would be negatively affected by the activities provided, they are not required to attend. We will not force students to participate, but rather want to provide the opportunity for them to improve as Talawanda students during BRAVE Day. They should stay in class during the event if they do not want to attend.

summary: **BRAVE Day** is Talawanda High School's annual family-building and diversity event for sophomores, taking place **Friday, November 14th**. The day focuses on anti-bullying and personal empowerment through story-sharing, activities, and listening, helping students realize they have a supportive community at THS. This program has been running since 2009 and participation is optional—students who prefer not to attend should stay in their regular classes.

title: Senior Yearbook Portrait Submission Instructions
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
SENIORS

SENIORS

Senior Yearbook Portrait Information -Follow these instructions to submit your portrait for the 2026 yearbook!1. Use the link - https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0jPvxM8 2. Use the access code: talawanda20263. Upload a picture greater than 1MBIf you are submitting a senior portrait, please follow these rules!Photos must be submitted in portrait format, NOT landscapePhoto must be greater than 1MB in filesizePortrait must follow the student code of conduct - no guns, drugs, etcBlack and white photos are DISCOURAGEDThe deadline to submit a senior photo is MARCH 27th! Don't wait until the last minute!

summary:
Seniors must submit their yearbook portraits by **March 27th** using the upload link: https://snap.yearbookforever.com/snap/index.html#/upload/zHyQp1T7hhSDb3iRg0jPvxM8 (access code: **talawanda2026**). 

**Requirements:**
- Portrait format (not landscape)
- File size greater than 1MB
- Follow student code of conduct
- Black and white photos discouraged

Don't wait until the last minute!

title: RISE Research Study for 5th Graders with ADHD
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
RISE Project
The Cincinnati Children’s RISE: Resilience In Student Education project is offering an important research opportunity focused on understanding and promoting resilience among 5th grade students with ADHD or who experience difficulties with paying attention or hyperactive/impulsive behaviors. Caregivers and students can receive up to $320 for completing questionnaires about academics, organization skills, and social-emotional well-being. Complete our interest form: https://redcap.link/RISEstudy. Contact RISE at RISEstudy@cchmc.org, call 513-803-6321, or visit: studentresilience.orgLINK to Flyer

summary:
Cincinnati Children's **RISE (Resilience In Student Education)** project is seeking 5th grade students with ADHD or attention/hyperactivity challenges to participate in a research study. Caregivers and students can earn **up to $320** for completing questionnaires about academics, organization skills, and social-emotional well-being. 

**To participate:** Complete the [interest form](https://redcap.link/RISEstudy), email RISEstudy@cchmc.org, call 513-803-6321, or visit studentresilience.org.

title: Early Bird Yearbook Sale Ends September 30th
source_title: Talawanda High School | Smore Newsletters for Education

blocks.content:
YEARBOOK 

NEWS

YEARBOOK NEWS

EARLY BIRD YEARBOOK SALE - $70.00Talawanda High School Parents!Do you want a THS yearbook at the lowest price of the year? Act quickly and you can get your copy for $70 before the price goes up September 30th!Go to yearbookforever.com and search ‘Talawanda’ - but make sure you select the High School and not the Middle School! Yearbooks are $70.00 and the deadline for Early Bird pricing is September 30th - the price goes up to $75 after September 30th!With the success of our mail distribution this Fall, we are going to have ALL the books our students order shipped to the address provided when ordering - not just the seniors! If you are moving, please make sure to contact yearbook@talawanda.org in the Fall so we can arrange to have your book picked up at the main office.

summary: **Talawanda High School yearbooks are now available for $70** through the Early Bird sale at [yearbookforever.com](http://yearbookforever.com) (search "Talawanda" and select High School). The price increases to $75 after **September 30th**. All yearbooks will be mailed to the address provided when ordering. If you're moving, contact yearbook@talawanda.org in the Fall to arrange pickup at the main office.

For additional information, please [view community flyers here](https://cdn.smore.com/u/20ea/9706538a6f8acb31dd3c5f91b3b77402.png).
